moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Ba4 b5: This was a mini-tournament game with all moves up to this pre-set.
moves.6... b4 7. O-O Nf6: This move develops the last piece between the King and the Rook, so that castling is possible. It also applies pressure to the e4 pawn.
moves.8. d3 O-O: With my King in safety, I am now able to attack.
moves.9. Bg5 h6: Kicking this Bishop. It is somewhat weakening to my King, but is still possibly the best move.
moves.14. Ba2 Rb8: This move is made to strengthen my pawn on b4.
moves.15. Nb3 Nxb3 16. Bxb3 Re8 17. Rc1 Be6: His Bishop was bearing down on me from afar, and I didn't like it.
moves.18. Bxe6 Qxe6: This unpins the Knight, and gets my Queen into a more attacking square.
moves.20. d4: 20. d4? A blunder that simply gives up both center pawns for one.
moves.24. Kh1: He breaks the pin on the f2 pawn.
moves.24... Re6 25. Qd1 Bd4 26. Re1 Rbe8: Not wishing to give up the file.
Here, he goes into a move-back-and-forth state...
moves.30... a5 31. Kh1 f5 32. Kh2 d5 33. Bf2 f: I gain space while he makes random moves.
moves.34. Ra1 Be3 35. Bxe3: A blunder that costs him the game.
